member.name: M:GleamTech.IO.TemporaryPath.GetContext

member.name: T:GleamTech.Reflection.AssemblyResourceHelper
member.summary: Class for handling resources embedded in assemblies. Allows case insensitive resource names.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Reflection.AssemblyResourceHelper.GetResourceStream(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the stream of an embedded resource from a given assembly. Allows case insensitive resource names.
member.param: Assembly which contains the embedded resource.
Namespace of the embedded resource in the assembly. Case insensitive values are allowed.
File path of the embedded resource in the assembly. Path should be in [Folder1]\[Folder2]\[FileName] format and case insensitive values are allowed.
member.returns: The stream of the embedded resource or null if the given resource name does not exist

member.name: T:GleamTech.Cryptography.MD5Managed
member.summary: MD5Managed: A HashAlgorithm implementation that acts as a thin wrapper around a C# translation of the MD5 reference implementation. The C code has been translated as closely as possible so that most of the original structure remains and comparisons between the two are straightforward.
member.remarks:
Derived from the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm.
Specification: RFC1321 - The MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc1321.html
Original license: Copyright (C) 1991-2, RSA Data Security, Inc. Created 1991. All rights reserved.
License to copy and use this software is granted provided that it is identified as the "RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm" in all material mentioning or referencing this software or this function.
License is also granted to make and use derivative works provided that such works are identified as "derived from the RSA Data Security, Inc. MD5 Message-Digest Algorithm" in all material mentioning or referencing the derived work.
RSA Data Security, Inc. makes no representations concerning either the merchantability of this software or the suitability of this software for any particular purpose. It is provided "as is" without express or implied warranty of any kind.
These notices must be retained in any copies of any part of this documentation and/or software.

member.name: T:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock
member.summary: Synchronization helper: a static lock collection associated with a key. NamedLock manages the lifetime of critical sections that can be accessed by a key (name) throughout the application. It also have some helper methods to allow a maximum wait time (timeout) to aquire the lock and safelly release it. Note: this nuget package contains c# source code and depends on System.Collections.Concurrent introduced in .Net 4.0.

member.name: P:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.IsLocked
member.summary: Check if a lock was aquired.

member.name: P:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Key
member.summary: Gets the lock key name.

member.name: P:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Lock
member.summary: Gets the internal lock object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The named lock key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources. Releases aquired lock and related resources.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Enter
member.summary: Tries to aquire a lock.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Enter(System.Int32)
member.summary: Tries to aquire a lock respecting the specified timeout.
member.param: The wait timeout milliseconds.
member.returns: If the lock was aquired in the specified timeout

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Enter(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Tries to aquire a lock respecting the specified timeout.
member.param: The wait timeout.
member.returns: If the lock was aquired in the specified timeout

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.Exit
member.summary: Releases the lock if it was already aquired. Called also at "Dispose".

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.CreateAndEnter(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance and tries to aquire a lock.
member.param: The named lock key.

member.summary: Creates a new instance and tries to aquire a lock.
member.param: The named lock key.
The wait timeout milliseconds.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Util.NamedLock.CreateAndEnter(System.String,System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Creates a new instance and tries to aquire a lock.
member.param: The name of the lock object.
The wait timeout.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonProvider.Default
member.summary: Use the standard logon provider for the system. The default security provider is negotiate, unless you pass NULL for the domain name and the user name is not in UPN format. In this case, the default provider is NTLM. NOTE: Windows 2000/NT: The default security provider is NTLM.

member.name: T:GleamTech.Security.LogonType
member.summary: Specifies the type of login used. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/aa378184.aspx

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.Interactive
member.summary: This logon type is intended for users who will be interactively using the computer, such as a user being logged on by a terminal server, remote shell, or similar process. This logon type has the additional expense of caching logon information for disconnected operations; therefore, it is inappropriate for some client/server applications, such as a mail server.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.Network
member.summary: This logon type is intended for high performance servers to authenticate plaintext passwords. The LogonUser function does not cache credentials for this logon type.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.Batch
member.summary: This logon type is intended for batch servers, where processes may be executing on behalf of a user without their direct intervention. This type is also for higher performance servers that process many plaintext authentication attempts at a time, such as mail or web servers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.Service
member.summary: Indicates a service-type logon. The account provided must have the service privilege enabled.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.Unlock
member.summary: GINAs are no longer supported. Windows Server 2003 and Windows XP: This logon type is for GINA DLLs that log on users who will be interactively using the computer. This logon type can generate a unique audit record that shows when the workstation was unlocked.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.NetworkClearText
member.summary: This logon type preserves the name and password in the authentication package, which allows the server to make connections to other network servers while impersonating the client. A server can accept plaintext credentials from a client, call LogonUser, verify that the user can access the system across the network, and still communicate with other servers.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Security.LogonType.NewCredentials
member.summary: This logon type allows the caller to clone its current token and specify new credentials for outbound connections. The new logon session has the same local identifier but uses different credentials for other network connections. This logon type is supported only by the LOGON32_PROVIDER_WINNT50 logon provider.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Collections.UniqueKeyedCollection`1.OnChange
member.summary: Called whenever the collection changes.

member.summary: Provides character based and byte based stream-like read operations over multiple streams and provides methods to add data to the front of the buffer.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.streams
member.summary: Holds the streams to read from, the stream on the top of the stack will be read first.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the default encoding of UTF8.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.#ctor(System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The encoding to use for character based operations.

member.name: P:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.CurrentEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the current encoding.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.HasData
member.summary: Returns true if there is any data left to read.
member.returns: True or false.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.Peek
member.summary: Returns the reader on the top of the stack but does not remove it.
member.returns: The .

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.Pop
member.summary: Returns the reader on the top of the stack and removes it
member.returns: The .

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.Push(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Pushes data to the front of the stack. The most recently pushed data will be read first.
member.param: The data to add to the stack.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.Read
member.summary: Reads a single byte as an integer from the stack. Returns -1 if no data is left to read.
member.returns: The that was read.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes from the stack, starting from a specified point in the byte array.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The index of buffer to start reading into.
The number of bytes to read into the buffer.
member.returns: The number of bytes read into buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of characters from the stack, starting from a specified point in the byte array.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The index of buffer to start reading into.
The number of characters to read into the buffer.
member.returns: The number of characters read into buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.ReadByteLine
member.summary: Reads the specified number of characters from the stack, starting from a specified point in the byte array.
member.returns: A byte array containing all the data up to but not including the next newline in the stack.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.ReadByteLine(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Reads a line from the stack delimited by the newline for this platform. The newline characters will not be included in the stream
member.param: This will be set to true if we did not end on a newline but instead found the end of our data.
member.returns: The containing the line.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.ReadLine
member.summary: Reads a line from the stack delimited by the newline for this platform. The newline characters will not be included in the stream
member.returns: The containing the line.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.ReadLine(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Reads a line from the stack delimited by the newline for this platform. The newline characters will not be included in the stream
member.param: This will be set to true if we did not end on a newline but instead found the end of our data.
member.returns: The containing the line.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.BinaryStreamStack.NextStream
member.summary: Removes the current reader from the stack and ensures it is correctly destroyed and then returns the next available reader. If no reader is available this method returns null.
member.returns: The next reader.

member.name: T:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.MultipartParser
member.summary:
Provides methods to parse a
multipart/form-data
stream into it's parameters and file data.

remarks.para: A parameter is defined as any non-file data passed in the multipart stream. For example any form fields would be considered a parameter.

The parser determines if a section is a file or not based on the presence or absence of the filename argument for the Content-Type header. If filename is set then the section is assumed to be a file, otherwise it is assumed to be parameter data.

member.name: F:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.MultipartParser.DefaultBufferSize
member.summary: The default buffer size.

member.summary: The boundary of the multipart message as a string.

member.summary: The boundary of the multipart message as a byte string encoded with CurrentEncoding

member.summary: The end boundary of the multipart message as a string.

member.summary: The end boundary of the multipart message as a byte string encoded with CurrentEncoding

member.summary: Determines if we have consumed the end boundary binary and determines if we are done parsing.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the stream, input encoding and buffer size. Boundary is automatically detected.
member.param: The stream containing the multipart data
The encoding of the multipart data
The size of the buffer to use for parsing the multipart form data. This must be larger then (size of boundary + 4 + # bytes in newline).

member.param: The stream containing the multipart data
The multipart/form-data boundary. This should be the value returned by the request header.

The size of the buffer to use for parsing the multipart form data. This must be larger then (size of boundary + 4 + # bytes in newline).

member.param: The data containing the newline

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.MultipartParser.Parse(GleamTech.Web.Multipart.RebufferableBinaryReader)
member.summary: Begins the parsing of the stream into objects.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.MultipartParser.ParseSection(GleamTech.Web.Multipart.RebufferableBinaryReader)
member.summary: Parses the header of the next section of the multipart stream and determines if it contains file data or parameter data.
member.param: The StreamReader to read data from.
member.exception: thrown if unexpected data is hit such as end of stream.

member.summary: Reads a single byte as an integer from the stream. Returns -1 if no data is left to read.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.RebufferableBinaryReader.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes from the stream, starting from a specified point in the byte array.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The index of buffer to start reading into.
The number of bytes to read into the buffer.
member.returns: The number of bytes read into buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.RebufferableBinaryReader.Read(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of characters from the stream, starting from a specified point in the byte array.
member.param: The buffer to read data into.
The index of buffer to start reading into.
The number of characters to read into the buffer.
member.returns: The number of characters read into buffer. This might be less than the number of characters requested if that many characters are not available, or it might be zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:GleamTech.Web.Multipart.RebufferableBinaryReader.ReadByteLine
member.summary: Reads a series of bytes delimited by the byte encoding of newline for this platform. the newline bytes will not be included in the return data.
member.returns: A byte array containing all the data up to but not including the next newline in the stack.
